TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit ClientSideProviderDescription extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Describes the scope of a client-side UI Automation provider so that it can be registered with the UI Automation client application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Automation.ClientSideProviderFactoryCallback clientSideProviderFactoryCallback, string className) cil managed

Docs.param: The method that creates the client-side provider for a window.
The class name of the windows that the provider is used for.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When UI Automation encounters a window of class `className`, it calls `clientSideProviderFactoryCallback` to create an instance of the client-side provider.
If `className` is `null`, the provider is used for all windows for which no other provider is found.
## Examples For example code, see [Create a Client-Side UI Automation Provider](~/docs/framework/ui-automation/create-a-client-side-ui-automation-provider.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public ClientSideProviderDescription (System.Windows.Automation.ClientSideProviderFactoryCallback clientSideProviderFactoryCallback, string className, string imageName, System.Windows.Automation.ClientSideProviderMatchIndicator flags);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Automation.ClientSideProviderFactoryCallback clientSideProviderFactoryCallback, string className, string imageName, valuetype System.Windows.Automation.ClientSideProviderMatchIndicator flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The method that creates the client-side provider for a window.
The class name of the window that the provider is used for.
The name of the executable or DLL for the process where the window resides.
Flags that specify behavior when matching window class names.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] encounters a window of class `className` within the process specified by `imageName`, it calls `clientSideProviderFactoryCallback` to create an instance of the client-side provider.
If `className` is `null`, the provider is used for all windows for which no other provider is found.
If `imageName` is `null`, the provider is used for all processes containing the window class.

Docs.summary: Gets the class name of the windows that the provider is used for.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ClientSideProviderDescription.ClassName%2A> is `null`, the provider is called for all windows for which no other provider is found.

Docs.summary: Gets the method that creates the client-side provider.
Gets the flags that specify behavior when matching window class names.
Gets the name of the executable or [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dll](~/includes/tlasharptla-dll-md.md)] for the process where the window resides.
